intro: Lycoseris sodiroi, commonly known as the Andean lily, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Alstroemeriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that often display vibrant colors. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and humid conditions. Its leaves are usually broad and grass-like, while its stems are often erect and fibrous. Lycoseris sodiroi plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting local pollinators and contributing to biodiversity.
